main event: Four star-shaped bright lights were observed in Warsaw, NY on October 21, 1959, stationary for 30 minutes.
interesting points: The lights were described as being the size of a half dollar,The colors observed were white and red,Two lights formed a pair while the other two were scattered,The red color appeared as a tail that alternately appeared and disappeared,The atmospheric conditions suggested the sighting could be due to a superior mirage.
witness description: A reliable race-horse trainer from Warsaw, NY.
